yedioth-ahronoth.name: Noni Mozes
yedioth-ahronoth.bio: Longtime publisher of Yedioth Ahronoth who inherited control of the newspaper from his father Noah Mozes.

yedioth-ahronoth.name: Ron Yaron
yedioth-ahronoth.bio: Chief executive overseeing the operations of the Yedioth Ahronoth media group including its digital properties.

yedioth-ahronoth.name: Nahum Barnea
yedioth-ahronoth.bio: Award-winning journalist and Israel Prize laureate known as one of Israel's most influential political commentators.

yedioth-ahronoth.name: Yoel Esteron
yedioth-ahronoth.bio: Veteran Israeli journalist who served as editor-in-chief and later founded The Marker financial newspaper.

delek-group.name: Yitzhak Tshuva
delek-group.bio: Israeli billionaire businessman who built Delek Group into a major energy and infrastructure conglomerate.

delek-group.name: Idan Wallace
delek-group.bio: Chief executive officer leading Delek Group's strategic operations across energy, infrastructure, and financial services.

delek-group.name: Barak Mashraki
delek-group.bio: Chief financial officer responsible for the financial management and reporting of Delek Group's diversified portfolio.

delek-group.name: Asi Bartfeld
delek-group.bio: Former chief executive who helped guide Delek Group through significant expansion in the natural gas sector.

tnuva.name: Eyal Malis
tnuva.bio: Chief executive officer of Tnuva, Israel's largest food manufacturer and distributor.

tnuva.name: Arik Reichman
tnuva.bio: Former chief executive who led Tnuva during a period of significant corporate transformation and international ownership changes.

tnuva.name: Haim Gavrieli
tnuva.bio: Chairman of Tnuva's board of directors overseeing corporate governance of the dairy and food giant.

tnuva.name: Pini Weinstein
tnuva.bio: Senior marketing executive responsible for Tnuva's iconic brand positioning in the Israeli food market.

strauss-group.name: Ofra Strauss
strauss-group.bio: Third-generation leader of the Strauss family who chairs Strauss Group, one of Israel's largest food and beverage companies.

strauss-group.name: Giora Bardea
strauss-group.bio: Chief executive officer managing Strauss Group's international food and coffee operations across multiple markets.

strauss-group.name: Michael Strauss
strauss-group.bio: Second-generation patriarch who expanded Strauss from a small dairy into a global food and beverage conglomerate.

strauss-group.name: Zion Balas
strauss-group.bio: Chief financial officer overseeing Strauss Group's financial strategy and reporting for its global operations.

bank-hapoalim.name: Dov Kotler
bank-hapoalim.bio: Chief executive of Bank Hapoalim, Israel's largest bank by assets, leading its digital transformation and growth strategy.

bank-hapoalim.name: Ruben Krupik
bank-hapoalim.bio: Chairman of the board of Bank Hapoalim overseeing governance of Israel's largest financial institution.

bank-hapoalim.name: Amir Tirosh
bank-hapoalim.role: Deputy CEO, Head of Corporate Division
bank-hapoalim.bio: Senior executive heading the corporate banking division at Bank Hapoalim.

bank-hapoalim.name: Uri Levin
bank-hapoalim.bio: Chief financial officer responsible for financial strategy and regulatory reporting at Israel's biggest bank.

snyk.name: Guy Podjarny
snyk.bio: Israeli-British entrepreneur who co-founded Snyk to help developers find and fix vulnerabilities in open-source code.

snyk.name: Peter McKay
snyk.bio: Experienced technology executive who joined Snyk as CEO to scale the developer security platform globally.

snyk.name: Assaf Hefetz
snyk.bio: Co-founder serving as chief technology officer driving Snyk's core developer security technology platform.

snyk.name: Danny Grander
snyk.bio: Co-founder who leads Snyk's security research team identifying vulnerabilities in open-source ecosystems.

monday-com.name: Roy Mann
monday-com.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who co-founded Monday.com and led it from a startup to a publicly traded work management platform.

monday-com.name: Eran Zinman
monday-com.bio: Co-founder and chief technology officer who built Monday.com's core technical architecture and engineering culture.

monday-com.name: Eliran Glazer
monday-com.bio: Chief financial officer who guided Monday.com through its successful IPO on NASDAQ in 2021.

monday-com.name: Vered Raviv Schwarz
monday-com.bio: Chief operating officer managing Monday.com's business operations and corporate strategy.

taboola.name: Adam Singolda
taboola.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who founded Taboola in 2007 and built it into one of the world's largest content discovery platforms.

taboola.name: Stephen Walker
taboola.bio: Chief financial officer overseeing Taboola's financial strategy following its public listing via SPAC.

taboola.name: Eldad Maniv
taboola.bio: President and chief operating officer managing day-to-day operations of Taboola's global ad-tech business.

taboola.name: Lior Golan
taboola.bio: Chief technology officer leading Taboola's engineering and AI-driven content recommendation algorithms.

jfrog.name: Shlomi Ben Haim
jfrog.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who co-founded JFrog and led it to a successful NASDAQ IPO as a leading DevOps platform.

jfrog.name: Yoav Landman
jfrog.bio: Co-founder and chief technology officer who created JFrog Artifactory, the company's flagship binary repository manager.

jfrog.name: Fred Simon
jfrog.bio: Co-founder serving as chief architect responsible for the technical vision of JFrog's DevOps platform.

jfrog.name: Jacob Shulman
jfrog.bio: Chief financial officer who managed JFrog's financial operations during its rapid growth and public offering.

israel-defense-forces-idf.name: Herzi Halevi
israel-defense-forces-idf.bio: Lieutenant General serving as the 23rd Chief of the General Staff of the Israel Defense Forces since January 2023.

israel-defense-forces-idf.name: Yair Golan
israel-defense-forces-idf.bio: Major General who served as Deputy Chief of the IDF General Staff and later entered Israeli politics.

israel-defense-forces-idf.name: Aviv Kohavi
israel-defense-forces-idf.role: Former Chief of the General Staff
israel-defense-forces-idf.bio: Lieutenant General who served as the 22nd Chief of the General Staff of the IDF from 2019 to 2023.

israel-defense-forces-idf.name: Gadi Eisenkot
israel-defense-forces-idf.role: Former Chief of the General Staff
israel-defense-forces-idf.bio: Lieutenant General who served as the 21st Chief of the General Staff and later became an Israeli government minister.

israel-defense-forces-idf.name: Yehuda Fox
israel-defense-forces-idf.bio: Major General serving as Deputy Chief of the IDF General Staff responsible for operational coordination.

playtika.name: Robert Antokol
playtika.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who co-founded Playtika and grew it into one of the world's largest mobile gaming companies.

playtika.name: Uri Shahak
playtika.bio: Co-founder and chief operating officer who helped build Playtika from a startup into a gaming industry giant.

playtika.name: Craig Abrahams
playtika.bio: President and chief financial officer who led Playtika through its IPO on the NASDAQ exchange in 2021.

playtika.name: Nir Korczak
playtika.bio: Chief marketing officer responsible for Playtika's user acquisition and brand strategy across its mobile gaming portfolio.

israel-discount-bank.name: Uri Levin
israel-discount-bank.bio: Chief executive officer leading Israel Discount Bank, one of the country's three largest commercial banks.

israel-discount-bank.name: David Levi
israel-discount-bank.bio: Chairman of the board of directors at Israel Discount Bank overseeing corporate governance and strategy.

israel-discount-bank.name: Ruth Farkash
israel-discount-bank.bio: Deputy chief executive officer responsible for retail banking operations at Israel Discount Bank.

israel-discount-bank.name: Mordechai Teri
israel-discount-bank.bio: Chief financial officer managing financial reporting and regulatory compliance at Israel Discount Bank.

payoneer.name: John Caplan
payoneer.bio: Chief executive officer of Payoneer who joined to scale the global payments and commerce platform for cross-border businesses.

payoneer.name: Yuval Tal
payoneer.bio: Israeli fintech entrepreneur who founded Payoneer in 2005 to simplify cross-border payments for businesses worldwide.

payoneer.name: Scott Galit
payoneer.bio: Former chief executive who led Payoneer through a decade of growth and its public listing via SPAC merger.

payoneer.name: Bea Ordonez
payoneer.bio: Chief financial officer overseeing Payoneer's financial and treasury operations as a publicly traded fintech company.

shin-bet-israel-security-agency.name: Ronen Bar
shin-bet-israel-security-agency.bio: Head of the Israel Security Agency (Shin Bet) appointed in 2021 to lead Israel's domestic intelligence service.

shin-bet-israel-security-agency.name: Nadav Argaman
shin-bet-israel-security-agency.bio: Former head of Shin Bet who led the agency from 2016 to 2021 during a period of evolving security threats.

shin-bet-israel-security-agency.name: Yoram Cohen
shin-bet-israel-security-agency.bio: Former director of the Israel Security Agency who served from 2011 to 2016.

shin-bet-israel-security-agency.name: Yuval Diskin
shin-bet-israel-security-agency.bio: Former head of Shin Bet from 2005 to 2011 who became a prominent critic of Israeli government policy after retirement.

cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.name: Abraham
cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.bio: Biblical patriarch believed to be buried at the site, revered as the father of monotheism in Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.

cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.name: Sarah
cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.bio: Biblical matriarch and wife of Abraham, traditionally believed to be interred at the Cave of Machpelah in Hebron.

cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.name: Herod the Great
cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.bio: King of Judea who constructed the monumental stone enclosure over the Cave of the Patriarchs around 31 BCE.

cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.name: Saladin
cave-of-the-patriarchs-hebron.bio: Muslim sultan who recaptured Hebron in 1187 and converted part of the Herodian structure into a mosque.

temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.name: Solomon
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.bio: Biblical king of Israel credited with constructing the First Temple on the Temple Mount in Jerusalem around 957 BCE.

temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.name: Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.role: Builder of the Dome of the Rock
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.bio: Umayyad caliph who commissioned the Dome of the Rock on the Temple Mount, completed around 691 CE.

temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.name: Herod the Great
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.role: Builder of the Second Temple Platform
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.bio: King of Judea who massively expanded the Second Temple and its platform creating the Temple Mount as it exists today.

temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.name: Muhammad Ahmad Hussein
temple-mount-haram-al-sharif.bio: Grand Mufti of Jerusalem and senior Islamic authority overseeing religious affairs at the Haram al-Sharif compound.

israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.name: Raviv Zoller
israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.bio: Chief executive officer leading ICL Group's global specialty minerals and chemicals operations.

israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.name: Aviram Lahav
israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.bio: Chief financial officer responsible for ICL's financial management and investor relations.

israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.name: Johanan Locker
israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.bio: Chairman of the board of ICL Group overseeing corporate governance of the global specialty minerals company.

israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.name: Elampara Raja
israel-chemicals-ltd-icl.bio: Division president overseeing ICL's industrial products business segment and global operations.

nso-group.name: Shalev Hulio
nso-group.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who co-founded NSO Group and developed the Pegasus spyware used by governments worldwide.

nso-group.name: Omri Lavie
nso-group.bio: Co-founder of NSO Group who helped create the company's controversial cyber intelligence technology.

nso-group.name: Yaron Shohat
nso-group.bio: Chief executive officer who took over leadership of NSO Group amid international scrutiny over the Pegasus spyware.

nso-group.name: Niv Carmi
nso-group.bio: Third co-founder of NSO Group whose initials along with those of his co-founders form the company's name.

masada-national-park.name: Herod the Great
masada-national-park.bio: King of Judea who built the lavish palace-fortress complex atop Masada between 37 and 31 BCE.

masada-national-park.name: Elazar Ben Yair
masada-national-park.role: Leader of the Jewish Revolt at Masada
masada-national-park.bio: Jewish Sicarii leader who commanded the final stand of 960 Jewish rebels against Rome at Masada in 73 CE.

masada-national-park.name: Yigael Yadin
masada-national-park.bio: Renowned Israeli archaeologist who led the landmark excavation of Masada from 1963 to 1965, uncovering its ancient remains.

masada-national-park.name: Flavius Josephus
masada-national-park.bio: Romano-Jewish historian whose writings in 'The Jewish War' provide the primary account of the siege and fall of Masada.

ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.name: Eliezer Kostiner
ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.bio: Former chief executive who led Ahava's growth as a premium Dead Sea mineral cosmetics brand in global markets.

ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.name: Yaacov Kirshenbaum
ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.bio: Co-founder of Ahava who helped establish the company to commercialize Dead Sea minerals for skincare products.

ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.name: Zvi Jonish
ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.bio: Chief executive officer leading Ahava Dead Sea Laboratories' international beauty and skincare operations.

ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.name: Tova Levin
ahava-dead-sea-laboratories.bio: Head of research and development directing Ahava's innovation in Dead Sea mineral-based cosmetic formulations.

check-point-software-technologies.name: Gil Shwed
check-point-software-technologies.bio: Israeli billionaire technologist who co-founded Check Point in 1993 and invented the first commercial firewall.

check-point-software-technologies.name: Nadav Zafrir
check-point-software-technologies.bio: Former commander of IDF Unit 8200 who became CEO of Check Point Software Technologies.

check-point-software-technologies.name: Shlomo Kramer
check-point-software-technologies.bio: Serial cybersecurity entrepreneur who co-founded Check Point and later founded Imperva and Cato Networks.

check-point-software-technologies.name: Marius Nacht
check-point-software-technologies.bio: Co-founder and vice chairman of Check Point who helped build it into the world's leading network security company.

bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.name: Boris Schatz
bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.bio: Bulgarian-born sculptor who founded the Bezalel School of Arts and Crafts in Jerusalem in 1906.

bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.name: Adi Stern
bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.bio: President of Bezalel Academy leading the institution as one of the most prestigious art and design schools in the Middle East.

bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.name: Ran Morin
bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.bio: Prominent Israeli sculptor and educator who served as dean of the Fine Arts department at Bezalel Academy.

bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.name: Mike Turner
bezalel-academy-of-arts-and-design.bio: Renowned Israeli architect and UNESCO advisor who served as dean of architecture at Bezalel Academy.

israeli-wine-industry.name: Baron Edmond de Rothschild
israeli-wine-industry.bio: French-Jewish philanthropist who founded Carmel Winery in 1882, launching the modern Israeli wine industry.

israeli-wine-industry.name: Eli Ben Zaken
israeli-wine-industry.bio: Pioneer vintner who founded Domaine du Castel and helped spark the Israeli boutique wine revolution in the 1990s.

israeli-wine-industry.name: David Ziv
israeli-wine-industry.bio: Chief executive of Carmel Winery, Israel's oldest and largest wine producer.

israeli-wine-industry.name: Yair Margalit
israeli-wine-industry.bio: Physicist-turned-winemaker and author of key books on Israeli winemaking who helped professionalize the industry.

world-jewish-congress-israel-office.name: Ronald Lauder
world-jewish-congress-israel-office.bio: American billionaire businessman and philanthropist serving as president of the World Jewish Congress since 2007.

world-jewish-congress-israel-office.name: Robert Singer
world-jewish-congress-israel-office.bio: Former chief executive of the World Jewish Congress who managed the organization's global operations.

world-jewish-congress-israel-office.name: Maram Stern
world-jewish-congress-israel-office.bio: Senior diplomat serving as acting CEO of the World Jewish Congress coordinating global Jewish community advocacy.

world-jewish-congress-israel-office.name: Evelyn Sommer
world-jewish-congress-israel-office.bio: Longtime leader and chair of the World Jewish Congress North American section championing Jewish advocacy worldwide.

iec-israel-electric-corporation.name: Meir Spiegler
iec-israel-electric-corporation.bio: Chief executive officer of the Israel Electric Corporation, the country's primary electricity generation and distribution utility.

iec-israel-electric-corporation.name: Yiftah Ron-Tal
iec-israel-electric-corporation.bio: Former chairman of the board of the Israel Electric Corporation who led corporate restructuring efforts.

iec-israel-electric-corporation.name: Ofer Bloch
iec-israel-electric-corporation.bio: Former chief executive who oversaw major infrastructure modernization projects at Israel Electric Corporation.

iec-israel-electric-corporation.name: Pinhas Rutenberg
iec-israel-electric-corporation.bio: Russian-born Zionist engineer who founded the Palestine Electric Company in 1923, the precursor to IEC.

jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.name: Theodor Herzl
jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.bio: Father of modern political Zionism who proposed the establishment of a national fund at the Fifth Zionist Congress in 1901.

jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.name: Johann Kremenezky
jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.bio: Austrian industrialist who served as the first president of the Jewish National Fund from its founding in 1901.

jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.name: Avraham Duvdevani
jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.bio: Chairman of KKL-JNF overseeing Israel's largest land development and environmental organization.

jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.name: Yehiel Leket
jewish-national-fund-keren-kayemeth-leis.bio: Director general managing KKL-JNF's operations including afforestation, water management, and land development across Israel.
